feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 09 at 7:07PM AKST until February 10 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills 40 to 50 below zero occurring. * WHERE...Chukchi Sea Coast. * WHEN...Now to 3 PM Thursday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin.

entry.title: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 09 at 7:07PM AKST until February 10 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills 40 to 50 below zero occurring. * WHERE...St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast. * WHEN...Now to 3 PM Thursday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin.
entry.cap:areaDesc: St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast

entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...South winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph expected. * WHERE...Skagway. * WHEN...From noon Wednesday to 6 AM AKST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds may blow down trees and power lines.

entry.summary: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THURSDAY TO 1 AM AKST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Pribilof Islands. * WHEN...From 6 AM Thursday to 1 AM AKST Friday.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 09 at 2:07PM AKST until February 10 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 PM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow expected. Plan on areas of poor visibilities and slick roadways to create difficult travel conditions at times. Winds gusting as high as 20 mph will cause areas of blowing and drifting snow.

entry.title: Blizzard Warning issued February 09 at 2:07PM AKST until February 11 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO MIDNIGHT AKST THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Travel will be very difficult to impossible. * WHERE...Along summits of the Steese Highway. * WHEN...Midnight to midnight Thursday night.

entry.title: Avalanche Warning issued February 09 at 12:44PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: The following message is transmitted at the request of the Valdez Avalanche Center. ...THE VALDEZ AVALANCHE CENTER HAS ISSUED AN AVALANCHE WARNING... * WHAT...Avalanche warning. The avalanche danger is high. Very dangerous avalanche conditions exist. * WHERE...For the mountains in and around Valdez and Thompson

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued February 09 at 8:56PM PST until February 10 at 7:00PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...LONG PERIOD NORTHWEST SWELL WILL BRING RISK OF SNEAKER WAVES TO BEACHES EARLY THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... .A long period northwest swell with period 16 to 18 seconds is forecast to start impacting the coastal waters early Thursday morning. This enhanced wave energy will increase the risk of sneaker waves and rip currents. With warm weather in the forecast,
entry.cap:areaDesc: Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore; Northern Monterey Bay; San Francisco; San Francisco Peninsula Coast; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued February 09 at 5:17PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR INCREASED RIVER FLOW AND POSSIBLE ICE JAM FORMATION IS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Emergency Management has reported the breakup of the ice jam south of Lake Oconee. Minor in bank rises are expected as the ice and water from this jam move downstream. If additional ice jams occur, minor flooding of low lying areas is possible.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued February 09 at 4:57PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR INCREASED RIVER FLOW AND POSSIBLE ICE JAM FORMATION IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...The break up of an ice jam west of Columbus is expected to produce water rises along the Loup River.
